Docs.summary: Specifies initialization options for bitmap images.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions.PreservePixelFormat?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is not selected, the T:System.Windows.Media.PixelFormat?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True of the image is chosen by the system depending on what the system determines will yield the best performance. Enabling this option preserves the file format but may result in lesser performance.
If BitmapCreateOptions is set to F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions.IgnoreColorProfile?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, calls to methods such as M:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.CopyPixels(System.Array,System.Int32,System.Int32)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=False will not return color-corrected bits.
When F:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions.IgnoreImageCache?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is selected, any existing entries in the image cache are replaced even if they share the same T:System.Uri?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.
